data.title: Can't access UNC share on Windows Server 2003
data.meta_description: I had a mix of Windows Server 2003/2008/2012 R2 DC servers, and everything was on DFL 2003 and now we migrated all Windows Servers 2003/2008 to Windows 2012 R2 and raised the DFL to 2012 R2, sense then we can’t connect t…
data.text:
I had a mix of Windows Server 2003/2008/2012 R2 DC servers, and everything was on DFL 2003 and now we migrated all Windows Servers 2003/2008 to Windows 2012 R2 and raised the DFL to 2012 R2, sense then we can’t connect to Windows Servers 2003 shares. We can Ping and RDP to the Servers using the host name and IP.

Also we can access the shares on the Windows 2003 shares via IP, but not by host name.

However on the Windows 2003 boxes I can access all shares.

Any ideas? I am at a last now.

WAG here, if you are trying to access the shares on those old servers with Windows 10 or greater it’s likely they won’t connect due to old, insecure connection types.

Using EOL servers is a bad idea, not just for security reasons, but for situations like this.

Please let us know what OS your clients are using.
